title: Manasseh and Amon’s Evil Reigns
summary: Manasseh becomes king and does great evil, rebuilding idolatrous shrines and even setting up altars in the temple. His son Amon follows in his ways. Both kings provoke God's anger, setting the stage for Judah's downfall.

faq.question: Why was Manasseh considered so wicked?
faq.answer: He reversed his father’s reforms, practiced extreme idolatry, and shed innocent blood.

faq.question: What happened to Amon?
faq.answer: He was assassinated by his officials after just two years of rule.
